Canine Parvovirus.treatment_plan: Immediate hospitalization required. IV fluid therapy for dehydration is critical.
Canine Parvovirus.follow_up: Check white blood cell count daily. Isolate from other dogs for 2 weeks.
Canine Parvovirus.prognosis: Good with early aggressive treatment (80-90% survival).

Feline Panleukopenia.treatment_plan: Intensive supportive care. Isolation is mandatory.
Feline Panleukopenia.follow_up: Monitor electrolytes and glucose. Force feeding if anorexic.
Feline Panleukopenia.prognosis: Guarded to Poor depending on severity.

Rabies.treatment_plan: No cure. Euthanasia is recommended for confirmed cases due to zoonotic risk.
Rabies.follow_up: Report to local health authorities immediately.

Leptospirosis.treatment_plan: Antibiotic therapy and supportive care for kidney/liver function.
Leptospirosis.prognosis: Good if treated early; can lead to chronic kidney failure.

Salmonellosis.treatment_plan: Fluid therapy and antimicrobials if systemic.

Heartworm.prognosis: Good for Class 1-2; Guarded for Class 3-4.

Diabetes Mellitus.follow_up: Blood glucose curve every 1-2 weeks initially.

Hip Dysplasia.treatment_plan: Weight management, physical therapy, and pain control.

Laminitis.treatment_plan: Emergency. Cryotherapy (ice boots), stall rest, foot support.
Laminitis.follow_up: Radiographs to check for coffin bone rotation.

Colic.treatment_plan: Pain management, hydration, walking. Surgery for displacement/torsion.
